result.markdown:
--- title: "quarto-syntax-from-r" description: "This is a subtitle" date: "2025-06-27" categories: ["Quarto", "Literate Programming", "R"] --- ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(dplyr) library(tibble) library(stringr) library(ggplot2) library(babynames) library(janeaustenr) ``` ::: ## One way ```{.r .cell-code} for(bb in c("Danielle", "Jasmine")) { dat <- babynames |> filter(name == bb) pic <- ggplot(dat, aes(year, prop, fill = sex)) + geom_col() print(quarto_section(.title = bb, .level = 3)) print(quarto_tabset("Plot" = pic, "Data" = dat, .level = 4)) } ``` ### Danielle ::: {.panel-tabset} #### Plot ![](index_files/figure-html/tabs-and-headers-1.png){width=672} #### Data 
# A tibble: 129 × 5
    year sex   name         n       prop
               
 1  1937 F     Danielle     9 0.00000817
 2  1938 F     Danielle    88 0.0000771 
 3  1939 F     Danielle    72 0.0000635 
 4  1940 F     Danielle    38 0.0000322 
 5  1941 F     Danielle    65 0.0000522 
 6  1942 F     Danielle    57 0.000041  
 7  1943 F     Danielle    67 0.0000467 
 8  1944 F     Danielle    67 0.0000490 
 9  1945 F     Danielle    93 0.0000691 
10  1946 F     Danielle   136 0.0000843 
# ℹ 119 more rows
::: ### Jasmine ::: {.panel-tabset} #### Plot ![](index_files/figure-html/tabs-and-headers-2.png){width=672} #### Data 
# A tibble: 124 × 5
    year sex   name        n       prop

::: ## Or another ```{.r .cell-code} dat <- list() pic <- list() bbs <- paste0("Dan", c("", "i", "ni", "ny", "iel", "ielle", "iela")) for(bb in bbs) { dat[[bb]] <- babynames |> filter(name == bb) pic[[bb]] <- ggplot(dat[[bb]], aes(year, prop, fill = sex)) + geom_col() } quarto_output( quarto_tabsec(.title = "Plot", .content = pic, .level = 3), quarto_tabsec(.title = "Data", .content = dat, .level = 3) ) ``` ### Plot ::: {.panel-tabset} #### Dan ![](index_files/figure-html/tabs-and-headers-2-1.png){width=672} #### Dani ![](index_files/figure-html/tabs-and-headers-2-2.png){width=672} #### Danni ![](index_files/figure-html/tabs-and-headers-2-3.png){width=672} #### Danny ![](index_files/figure-html/tabs-and-headers-2-4.png){width=672} #### Daniel ![](index_files/figure-html/tabs-and-headers-2-5.png){width=672} #### Danielle ![](index_files/figure-html/tabs-and-headers-2-6.png){width=672} #### Daniela ![](index_files/figure-html/tabs-and-headers-2-7.png){width=672} ::: ### Data ::: {.panel-tabset} #### Dan

::: ## Passing markdown directly ```{.r .cell-code} quarto_markdown(prideprejudice[8:16], .sep = " ") ``` It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife. However little known the feelings or views of such a man may be on his first entering a neighbourhood, this truth is so well fixed in the minds of the surrounding families, that he is considered the rightful property of some one or other of their daughters. ```{.r .cell-code} quarto_markdown( "- this ends up being", "- a markdown list", "- with **formatting**", .sep = "\n" ) ``` - this ends up being - a markdown list - with **formatting** ## Divs and spans ```{.r .cell-code} quarto_div( "This is some margin text.", "The strings are pasted together,", "with a separator", .class = "column-margin", .sep = " " ) ``` ::: {.column-margin} This is some margin text. The strings are pasted together, with a separator ::: ```{.r .cell-code} quarto_div( "This is a callout note.", "The idea is the same, really.", .class = "callout-note", .sep = " " ) ``` ::: {.callout-note} This is a callout note. The idea is the same, really. ::: ```{.r .cell-code} quarto_paragraph( quarto_span(.content = "this is plain text"), quarto_span(.content = "this is highlighted", .class = "mark"), quarto_span(.content = "this is underlined", .class = "underline"), .sep = ", " ) ``` this is plain text, [this is highlighted]{.mark}, [this is underlined]{.underline}
